answers.answer: I personally have not, but my husband's aunt had her baby at 30 weeks after being in the hospital for 2 weeks with pre e. That was 28 years ago and he was fine. He did have to stay in the nicu for 5 or 6 weeks she said. Hope that helps.

My sister in law had her daughter at 29 weeks because she developed severe preeclampsia. To be honest, it was scary. We didn't know if she would make it being so under developed. They were both in the hospital for 65 days. She was in the nicu, in an incubator, and on a lot of assistance. But, she's now  three months old and doing amazing. Healthy, happy, and growing normal. It's hopeful!

I was rushed to hospital with PE at 28wks last pregnancy and they thought they were going to have to deliver. They told me baby would be fine but he'd probably have to stay in nicu until he would have been considered full term so 8-10wks. Ended up delivering at 35wks and 1wk nicu. I was told then it depends on their lung development and feeding but curious to hear others experience in case it happens again.

question: How did it go
title: did any body have they baby at 29 weeks
